description: Detects abusing Azure Browser SSO by requesting OAuth 2.0 refresh tokens for an Azure-AD-authenticated Windows user (i.e. the machine is joined to Azure AD and a user logs in with their Azure AD account) wanting to perform SSO authentication in the browser. An attacker can use this to authenticate to Azure AD in a browser as that user.
name: Abusing Azure Browser SSO
query: (file.path:*MicrosoftAccountTokenProvider.dll AND (NOT (process.executable:(*\\BackgroundTaskHost.exe OR *\\devenv.exe OR *\\iexplore.exe OR *\\MicrosoftEdge.exe OR *\\Microsoft\\Edge\\Application\\msedge.exe OR *\\AppData\\Local\\Microsoft\\OneDrive\\OneDrive.exe OR *\\msedgewebview2.exe OR *\\OneDrive.exe) OR process.executable:C\:\\Program\ Files\ \(x86\)\\Microsoft\\EdgeWebView\\Application\\*)))
author: Den Iuzvyk
